data.title: Allow MonoGame to be embedded inside GTK# applications (when using OpenTK)
Include assets by drag and drop
data.body:
Include assets by dropping on the Treeview window or the ContentProject
TreeNode.
Items that are outside the base directory are not supported.
Dropping items on a Folder node is not supported.
Dropping folders just add that folder to the project. does not add the
files from that folder.

data.title: [DX] Fix rounding error at SetClientBounds()
data.body:
_clientBounds was 800x479 on a L620 device and 799x479 on the emulator.
After the fix _clientBounds is set to 800x480.

data.title: Add RasterizerState.DepthClipEnable
data.body:
with implementation for Direct3D and OpenGL, and a visual test (which passes on both Direct3D and OpenGL).

On Direct3D, this corresponds to `RasterizerState.DepthClipEnable`. On OpenGL, this corresponds to calling `GL.Enable(DEPTH_CLAMP)`.

On Direct3D, this is not supported by level 9.x devices. On OpenGL, this is enabled by the ARB_depth_clamp extension. These restrictions are accounted for in `GraphicsCapabilities`.

(By the way, it was when running this visual test on OpenGL that I noticed that depth clipping wasn't working properly, even without these changes, which is what prompted the MojoShader fix.)

data.title: New docs & members for Matrix
data.body:
Changes:
-Fully documented Matrix
-New constructor which accepts 4 Vector4 for Matrix
-New properties Scale and Rotation for Matrix
-New overload for Matrix.CreateOrthographicOffCenter and Matrix.CreatePerspectiveOffCenter which accepts Rectangle as viewing volume
-operator+ optimization
-Added MatrixTest class

data.title: New tests for EnumConformingTest
data.body: Added tests for enums in Microsoft.Xna.Framework namespace.

data.title: Matrix docs & some new changes
data.body:
Changes:
-Fully documented Matrix
-New constructors which accepts 4 Vector4 for Matrix
-New properties Scale and Rotation for Matrix
-New overload for Matrix.CreateOrthographicOffCenter and Matrix.CreatePerspectiveOffCenter which accepts Rectangle as viewing volume
-Few doc fixes in Vector2

data.title: Matrix docs + some new changes
data.body:
This was huge work but I fully documented Matrix struct and bring some new changes.. So..

Changes:
-Docs for all Matrix members(excluding indexers)
-New properties for Matrix : Scale(get,set) which is (M11,M22,M33) and Rotation(get) - (simply returns quaternion representing rotation moment). 
-New constructor for matrix which accepts 4 Vector4 for fill up matrix
-New overload for CreateOrthographicOffCenter which accepts Rectangle as a viewing volume
-Added new Matrix test
-Improvement for operator+ performance in Matrix
-Few unification doc fixes in Vector2 
-Removed improvements.md (Tom recommended )
-Tests for enums in Microsoft.Xna.Framework added to EnumConformingTest

data.title: Remove PipelineProject parameter from PipelineProject constractor
data.body:
PipelineController creates a new PipelineProject on
.NewProject(),OpenProject(),ImportProject(), etc. You get this object
via IView.SetTreeRoot()
The initial PipelineProject is never used, the controller cannot be used
in that state (without initialized with one of the above methods)
because of ResolvedTypes(), importers,etc

data.title: Issue spritebach and custom shaders (potentially other shader usage) [WinDX] (example code)
[Gtk Pipeline Tool] Disabled copying of .so libs on MacOS
Rework of Xamarin Studio/MonoDevelop Addin
data.body:
Includes new templates and new Shared Projects support
Includes Pipeline Tool support
Removes old ProjectTemplates

This is just a Test PR for now to check for any build issues.

Also worth noting that once this is in , the old MonoDevelopContent addin will no longer be needed and will also be removed probably as part of the PR as well. This is because we don't want to support the old xna content projects moving forward , only the .mgcb ones which this new addin will take care of.

data.title: MGCB <output_filename>
Custom Effects page documentation improvement
data.body: Adds information about how aggressive compiler can be in regards to :register(s0) if pixel shader is not fully defined. I think it is quite important information to be in tips as it was not highlighted in MVA course and due to silent nature of error creates confusion.

data.title: AddResourceReference / RemoveResourceReference Performance Issues
data.body: Hello, ***I have started porting my existing game engine from Xna to MonoGame recently. The process goes well and MonoGame looks very good but I have faced some issues. I will create 1 bug per issue. MonoGame 3.3.0.2238 Issue 3: AddResourceReference / RemoveResourceReference Performance Issues I have noticed significant performance drop after porting my game from XNA to MonoGame (DX). Here is the Performance Analysis report from Visual Studio: ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11595800/6987977/8f91553c-da55-11e4-9403-be44e2b85d4e.jpg) ![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11595800/6987980/93e01024-da55-11e4-8f6c-a358df803796.jpg) ![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11595800/6987982/97989c9a-da55-11e4-933b-33a233a2a6dd.jpg) Looks like Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDevice.AddResourceReference and Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDevice.RemoveResourceReference methods are the root cause of the performance issues. Not sure it I'm doing something wrong but in XNA there were no such issues. Thank you!

data.title: New constuctors for Point
data.body:
Point(value) - Vector2 already have same thing so why not ?

update : new constructors with float type instead integer.

data.title: New constructors for Rectangle
data.body:
This constructor uses two Point's and helps developers to write their 2d games more clearly and faster. At least I found this helpful.

update : added Rectangle(Vector2,Vector2)  and Rectangle(float,float,float,float) constructors.

data.title: MGFX Render State Fixes
data.body:
This PR adds some missing render states into the MGFX parsing (stencil, scissor test, zfunc).

It also fixes the MGFX defaults for sampler states to match XNA.

Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2641.
